reading_comprehension_problems.passage:
Merely convincing your children that worry is senseless and that they would be more content if they didn't worry isn't going to stop them from worrying.
For some reason, young people seem to believe that worry is a fact of life over which they have little or no control.
Consequently, they don't even try to stop.
Therefore, you need to convince them that worry, like guilt and fear, is nothing more than an emotion, and like all emotions, is subject to the power of the will.
Tell them that they can eliminate worry from their lives by simply refusing to attend to it.
Explain to them that if they refuse to act worried regardless of how they feel, they will eventually stop feeling worried and will begin to experience the contentment that accompanies a worry-free life.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 목적으로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: 청소년기 걱정의 심리적 원인을 분석하기 위해
걱정과 두려움 같은 감정들을 구별하기 위해
자녀의 걱정을 멈추게 할 효과적인 방법을 조언하기 위해
걱정을 삶의 자연스러운 일부로 받아들이라고 설득하기 위해
자녀와의 대화에서 공감의 중요성을 강조하기 위해

answer.explanation: 이 글은 자녀의 걱정을 멈추게 하는 데 단순한 설득이 효과가 없다고 지적한 뒤, 'you need to convince them', 'Tell them', 'Explain to them' 등의 표현을 사용하여 부모가 자녀의 걱정을 다루도록 돕는 구체적이고 실질적인 방법을 단계별로 조언하고 있습니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 제목으로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: Worry: An Uncontrollable Fact of Youth?
The Power of Positive Thinking
Why Simply Talking Is Not Enough
Guiding Children to a Worry-Free Mind
The Thin Line Between Worry and Fear

answer.explanation: 이 글은 부모가 자녀를 '걱정 없는 마음(a Worry-Free Mind)' 상태로 '이끌어주는(Guiding)' 구체적인 방법을 제시하고 있습니다. 걱정을 통제 가능한 감정으로 재정의하고 행동 변화를 통해 감정을 변화시키는 전략을 소개하므로, 이 제목이 글 전체의 내용을 가장 잘 포괄합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 요지로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: Parents should understand that worrying is a natural and sometimes necessary phase for young people.
Young people can overcome the emotion of worry by willfully refusing to act worried.
The most effective way to help someone is to first convince them their problem is real.
Distinguishing between emotions like guilt and fear is the first step to managing them effectively.
A life completely free of worry is an unrealistic goal that can cause more stress.

answer.explanation: 글의 핵심 주장은 걱정이 의지에 의해 통제될 수 있는 감정이라는 것입니다. 글쓴이는 구체적인 방법으로, 젊은이들이 의지를 가지고 걱정하는 '행동'을 하길 거부하면 결국 걱정하는 '감정'을 극복할 수 있다고 말합니다. 이것이 글의 중심 메시지입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Merely convincing your children that worry is senseless and that they would be more content if they didn't worry isn't going to stop them from worrying. ( ① ) For some reason, young people seem to believe that worry is a fact of life over which they have little or no control. ( ② ) Therefore, you need to convince them that worry, like guilt and fear, is nothing more than an emotion, and like all emotions, is subject to the power of the will. ( ③ ) Tell them that they can eliminate worry from their lives by simply refusing to attend to it. ( ④ ) Explain to them that if they refuse to act worried regardless of how they feel, they will eventually stop feeling worried and will begin to experience the contentment that accompanies a worry-free life. ( ⑤ )
reading_comprehension_problems.question:
글의 흐름으로 보아, 주어진 문장이 들어가기에 가장 적절한 곳은?

**Consequently, they don't even try to stop.**

options.text: ①
②
③
④
⑤

answer.explanation: 주어진 문장은 '결과적으로, 그들은 멈추려고 시도조차 하지 않는다'는 내용입니다. 이 문장은 '젊은이들이 걱정을 통제 불가능한 것으로 믿는다'는 앞 문장의 직접적인 결과에 해당합니다. 통제할 수 없다고 믿기 때문에 멈추려는 시도를 하지 않는다는 논리적 흐름이 형성됩니다. 그리고 이 문제점 뒤에 '그러므로(Therefore), 당신은 그들을 설득해야 한다'며 해결책이 제시됩니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Merely convincing your children that worry is senseless and that they would be more content if they didn't worry isn't going to stop them from worrying.

question_blocks.A: Therefore, you need to convince them that worry, like guilt and fear, is nothing more than an emotion, and like all emotions, is subject to the power of the will.
question_blocks.B: For some reason, young people seem to believe that worry is a fact of life over which they have little or no control. Consequently, they don't even try to stop.
question_blocks.C: Tell them that they can eliminate worry from their lives by simply refusing to attend to it. Explain to them that if they refuse to act worried regardless of how they feel, they will eventually stop feeling worried and will begin to experience the contentment that accompanies a worry-free life.

reading_comprehension_problems.question: 주어진 글 다음에 이어질 글의 순서로 가장 적절한 것은?

answer.explanation: 주어진 문장은 '단순한 설득은 효과가 없다'는 문제 제기입니다. (B)는 그 이유를 설명합니다(젊은이들이 걱정을 통제 불가능하다고 믿기 때문). (A)는 'Therefore'를 통해 이 문제에 대한 해결책의 첫 단계를 제시합니다(걱정은 통제 가능한 감정임을 설득하라). (C)는 (A)에서 제시된 원칙을 바탕으로 구체적인 실행 방법('Tell them', 'Explain to them')을 설명하며 글을 마무리합니다. 따라서 (B)-(A)-(C) 순서가 가장 논리적입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Therefore, you need to convince them that worry, like guilt and fear, is nothing more than an emotion, and like all emotions, ____________________________. Tell them that they can eliminate worry from their lives by simply refusing to attend to it. Explain to them that if they refuse to act worried regardless of how they feel, they will eventually stop feeling worried and will begin to experience the contentment that accompanies a worry-free life.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 빈칸에 들어갈 말로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: is a natural response to stress
should be openly expressed
is a signal that something is wrong
is subject to the power of the will
can be analyzed and understood

answer.explanation: 빈칸이 포함된 문장은 걱정을 통제 가능한 것으로 재정의하는 글의 핵심 부분입니다. 이어지는 문장들은 의지적으로 걱정에 주의를 기울이지 않고('refusing to attend to it'), 걱정하는 행동을 하지 않음으로써('refuse to act worried') 걱정을 없앨 수 있다고 설명합니다. 이는 감정이 '의지의 힘에 지배를 받는다(is subject to the power of the will)'는 전제를 바탕으로 합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Merely convincing your children that worry is ① `senseless` and that they would be more content if they didn't worry isn't going to stop them from worrying. For some reason, young people seem to believe that worry is a fact of life over which they have little or no ② `control`. Consequently, they don't even try to stop. Therefore, you need to convince them that worry, like guilt and fear, is nothing more than an emotion, and like all emotions, is subject to the power of the will. Tell them that they can ③ `eliminate` worry from their lives by simply ④ `choosing` to attend to it. Explain to them that if they ⑤ `refuse` to act worried regardless of how they feel, they will eventually stop feeling worried...
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 밑줄 친 부분 중, 문맥상 낱말의 쓰임이 적절하지 않은 것은?

options.text: senseless
control
eliminate
choosing
refuse

answer.explanation: 필자가 제안하는 걱정 극복 방법은 걱정에 주의를 기울이기를 '거부하는(refusing)' 것입니다. ⑤의 'refuse to act worried(걱정스럽게 행동하기를 거부하다)'와 같은 맥락입니다. 따라서 걱정에 주의를 기울이기로 '선택한다(choosing to attend to it)'는 것은 글의 전체적인 조언과 정반대되는 내용이므로 문맥상 어색합니다. 'refusing'이 적절합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Merely (A) `convincing` your children that worry is senseless and that they would be more (B) `content` if they didn't worry isn't going to stop them from worrying. For some reason, young people seem to believe that worry is a fact of life over which they have little or no (C) `control`. ... Tell them that they can (D) `eliminate` worry from their lives by simply refusing to attend to it. ... they will begin to experience the contentment that (E) `accompanies` a worry-free life.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 밑줄 친 (A)~(E)에 대한 영영 풀이가 적절하지 않은 것은?

options.text: (A) convincing: making someone feel certain that something is true
(B) content: in a state of satisfaction and peaceful happiness
(C) control: the ability or power to make someone or something do what you want
(D) eliminate: to completely remove or get rid of something or someone
(E) accompanies: to go to a place with someone as their companion

answer.explanation: 본문의 (E) accompanies는 '걱정 없는 삶에 수반되는 만족감'이라는 의미로, '어떤 일이 다른 일과 동시에 일어나다' 또는 '~에 동반되다'라는 뜻입니다. 제시된 영영 풀이 '동반자로서 누군가와 어떤 장소에 가다'는 물리적인 동행을 의미하므로, 추상적인 개념에 사용된 본문의 의미와는 맞지 않습니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Merely convincing your children that worry is (A) [senseless / sensible] and that they would be more content if they didn't worry isn't going to stop them from worrying. For some reason, young people seem to believe that worry is a fact of life over which they have little or no (B) [control / observation]. ... Tell them that they can eliminate worry from their lives by simply (C) [refusing / accepting] to attend to it.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 각 네모 안에서 문맥에 맞는 낱말로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: senseless - control - refusing
senseless - observation - accepting
senseless - control - accepting
sensible - observation - refusing
sensible - control - refusing

answer.explanation: (A) 걱정이 '무의미하다(senseless)'고 설득하는 것을 의미합니다. 'sensible'은 '합리적인'이란 뜻입니다. (B) 젊은이들은 걱정에 대해 거의 또는 전혀 '통제력(control)'이 없다고 믿습니다. 'observation(관찰)'은 어색합니다. (C) 걱정을 없애는 방법은 그것에 주의를 기울이기를 '거부하는(refusing)' 것입니다. 'accepting(받아들이는 것)'은 글의 주장과 반대됩니다.

Therefore, you need to convince them that worry, like guilt and fear, is nothing more than an emotion, and like all emotions, is subject to the power of the will.
Tell them that they can eliminate worry from their lives by simply refusing to attend to it.

reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 내용과 일치하지 않는 것은?

options.text: 걱정이 무의미하다고 말하는 것만으로 자녀의 걱정을 멈추게 하긴 어렵다.
젊은이들은 걱정을 통제 불가능한 것으로 여기는 경향이 있다.
걱정은 죄책감이나 두려움처럼 의지의 힘으로 다룰 수 있는 감정이다.
걱정스러운 감정이 들더라도 걱정하는 듯한 행동을 의지적으로 멈춰야 한다.
걱정, 죄책감, 두려움은 각각의 특성이 달라 다른 방식으로 다뤄져야 한다.

answer.explanation: 본문은 'worry, like guilt and fear' (걱정은, 죄책감이나 두려움처럼)이라고 표현하며 이 감정들을 같은 범주로 묶고, 모두 의지의 힘에 종속된다고 설명합니다. 이는 이들을 유사한 방식으로 다룰 수 있음을 시사하는 것이지, 다른 방식으로 다루어야 한다는 의미가 아닙니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Merely convincing your children that worry is senseless and that they would be more content if they ① [didn't worry / wouldn't worry] isn't going to stop them from worrying. For some reason, young people seem to believe that worry is a fact of life over ② [which / that] they have little or no control. ... Explain to them that if they refuse to act ③ [worried / worryingly] regardless of how they feel, they will eventually stop feeling worried and will begin to experience the contentment that accompanies a worry-free life.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 각 네모 안에서 어법에 맞는 표현으로 가장 적절한 것을 각각 고르시오.

answer.explanation: if 가정법 과거 구문('if + 주어 + 동사의 과거형, 주어 + would/could/should/might + 동사원형')으로, 현재 사실에 대한 반대 가정을 나타냅니다. 따라서 if절에는 동사의 과거형인 'didn't worry'가 와야 합니다.
선행사 'a fact of life'를 수식하는 관계대명사절입니다. 원래 문장은 'they have little or no control over a fact of life'로, 전치사 'over'가 관계대명사 앞으로 이동한 형태입니다. 전치사 뒤에는 관계대명사 'that'을 사용할 수 없으므로 'which'가 맞습니다.
동사 'act'가 '~인 체하다', '~처럼 행동하다'라는 의미의 불완전자동사로 쓰일 때, 주어의 상태를 설명하는 형용사 보어를 취합니다. 따라서 형용사인 'worried'가 어법에 맞습니다. 부사 'worryingly'는 올 수 없습니다.
